medical_history.chief_complaint: Vague abdominal pain, low-grade, localized to right lower quadrant (RLQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began around 10pm the previous night, initially centered around the umbilicus and became more intense and localized to the RLQ after waking up. Patient took four Advil without relief and presented to the emergency department.
medical_history.family_history: Prostate cancer (father), diabetes mellitus (father), hypertension (father). No history of colorectal cancer or inflammatory bowel disease.
